identity.name: CineVault
principles: Content is King: UI recedes, artwork shines.
Cinematic Depth: Use layers, shadows, and glass to create depth.
Fluid Motion: Interactions should feel like a camera pan, smooth and deliberate.
Data as Art: Ratings and stats should look like HUD elements.

buttons.primary: bg-primary text-primary-foreground hover:bg-primary/90 shadow-[0_0_20px_rgba(99,102,241,0.3)] transition-all duration-300

cards.movie_poster: relative aspect-[2/3] overflow-hidden rounded-xl border border-white/10 bg-card transition-all duration-500 hover:scale-105 hover:shadow-2xl hover:shadow-primary/20 group

inputs.search: bg-secondary/50 border-white/10 focus:border-primary/50 focus:ring-primary/20 text-white placeholder:text-slate-500 h-12 rounded-full px-6

general: Implement a strict Dark Mode. Do not use white backgrounds anywhere.
Use 'Outfit' font for all headings and 'Inter' for body text.
Use the 'Bento Grid' layout for the Home/Discovery page.
Ensure all interactive elements have `data-testid` attributes.
Do not use generic gradients. Use the specified 'brand_glow' or 'glass' styles.
For the 'User Switcher', create a visually distinct profile selection screen (like Netflix).
Watchlists should support drag-and-drop reordering if possible, or at least clear visual sorting.

pages.home: Hero section with full-screen background image (hero_bg), followed by horizontal scrolling rails for 'Trending' and 'Popular'.
pages.search: Advanced filter sidebar (left) with glassmorphism. Grid results on the right.
pages.detail: Immersive header with backdrop image. 'Add to Watchlist' button must be prominent (Primary Color).
pages.watchlists: Kanban-style or List view options. Status tags (Watching, Plan to Watch) must be color-coded.

universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: `transition: all`. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add `.App { text-align: center; }` in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, parallax effects, and entrance animations. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors, selection states, and loading animations: separates good from extraordinary.
